Linear Mixed Model for Tumor Growth Data

Source: R/lmm.R
lmm.Rd

Linear Mixed Model for Tumor Growth Data

Usage

lmm(
  tumr_obj = NULL,
  formula = NULL,
  data = NULL,
  id = NULL,
  time = NULL,
  measure = NULL,
  group = NULL
)

Arguments

tumr_obj

takes tumr_obj created by tumr()

formula

linear mixed model formula

data

tumor growth data

id

Column of subject ID's

time

Column of repeated time measurements

measure

Column of repeated measurements of tumor

group

Column specifying the treatment group for each measurement

Value

summary of linear mixed model fit

Examples

data(melanoma1)
mel1 <- tumr(melanoma1, ID, Day, Volume, Treatment)
lmm(mel1)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML. t-tests use Satterthwaite's method [
#> lmerModLmerTest]
#> Formula: formula
#>    Data: data
#> 
#> REML criterion at convergence: 8207.2
#>

lmm(
tumr_obj = meta_data,
formula = "Volume ~ Day + (1 | ID)"
)
#> Error: object 'meta_data' not found

data(breast)
lmm(
data = breast,
id = "ID",
group = "Treatment",
time = "Week",
measure = "Volume"
)
#> boundary (singular) fit: see help('isSingular')
#> Linear mixed model fit by REML. t-tests use Satterthwaite's method [
#> lmerModLmerTest]
